page.title: 13PRISTON CUSTOMS
page.content: Every May day is celebrated with side shows, dancing and various stalls. On Halloween the children dress up as witches/wizards and knock on doors asking for a "trick or treat" . The idea is to get the occupant to give a sweet or goodie. If they refuse, a trick is played on them. On the same evening the Morris men dance round the village stopping for the odd beer. The Priston Jubilee Morris men were formed in 1977. Their repertoire of 25 dances came from Oxfordshire. A team of Morris men is called a "side" There are 12 members in the Priston side. Although Priston does not have a pitch it has a cricket club called the Priston Wanderers formed in 1985 it's first season
